On Wed, Oct 21, 2009 at 8:00 AM, remoliechti <remo.liechti@...> wrote=
:

> Well, the exception contains an error code which should be checked as =
well,
> so I thought, why not enhancing JUnit to check this as well:
> @Tes=
t(expected=3DMyException.class,errorCode=3D5)
>
I'm guessing "errorCode" is=
 specific to your exception class?  If so, it's
unlikely that this would be=
 useful to JUnit users in general.

On the other hand, something that I've =
found useful in TestNG is being able
to test the error message against a re=
gular exception:

@Test(expectedException=3DMyException.class, errorMessage=
 =3D ".*Too big.*")

You might want to consider this for JUnit since it's a=
pplicable regardless
of the exception class.

-- 
C=E9dric

ions of this message have been removed]
